title: Instructor Guide — ASL 2.7 Mini Dialogues
objectives: Coach two-person micro-dialogues using numbers, time-first, colors, places, and food/drink frames
Build natural switching between YES/NO and WH NMMs and keep turns compact (≤ 4–5 signs)
Enforce eye-gaze/backchannel habits and consistent descriptive order

Common Core.SL.9-10.1: Structured partner skits; accountable turn-taking in signed modality
Common Core.SL.9-10.6: Adapts NMM intensity and clause length to audience

ISTE.1.6: Creates concise signed media (micro-skits) for authentic audiences

CSTA.1A-CS-01: Represents data with symbols (numbers/colors/order) with precision

IDEA.UDL: Visual models, chunking, feedback stems, seating options

pacing.activity: Silent greet; posture/eye-gaze check; quick NMM demo (Y/N vs WH)
Warm-Up Q↔A swap (YES/NO → WH); enforce ≤4 signs/turn
Model Skit 1 (Class Time) + micro-checks; brief whole-class fixes
Partner Practice: draw 2 prompt cards; record notes on NMMs/eye gaze
Partner Practice round 2 (3rd prompt) + teacher roving feedback (Glow + Grow)
Mini-Showcase: 15–20s clip; upload + caption; assign quick reflection

roomSetup: Pairs facing each other with clear sightlines; quiet side wall for quick recording

prep: Queue 2 model skits (Class Time; Describe & Find)
Lay out prompt cards; set timer (20–30s per turn)
Open upload QR/LMS link for mini-showcase artifacts

IEP_504: Provide WH vs Y/N face cue card; extend time for first take
ELL: Bridge with short English captions on cards (fade quickly)
Picture prompts for food/colors/places to reduce load
Advanced: Add a follow-up ladder (Y/N → WH → WHAT-KIND?) while staying ≤5 signs/turn
Require consistent descriptive order across 3 turns
DeafBlind_futureReady: Tactile outline of one skit shape with aide; focus on order and turn-taking signals
UDL: Multiple exemplars; chunking; self-video review; feedback stems posted

teachingNotes.guidance: Enforce face first: receivers watch the signer’s FACE; signers keep hands compact. Cue: “FACE ↑ for Y/N; FACE ↓ for WH.”
Highlight time-first and crisp answers to WHAT-TIME? (number + O’CLOCK). Coach brief head tilt for Y/N.
Lock order: OBJECT → ADJ → COLOR. If students stack too much, split into two short clauses.
Run Glow + Grow: one praise + one precise cue (e.g., “GOOD. BROWS DOWN MORE.”). Keep each turn ≤30s.

checksForUnderstanding.prompt: Show WH-face vs Y/N-face on cue
checksForUnderstanding.lookFor: Brows down vs up, slight head tilt for Y/N

checksForUnderstanding.prompt: Partners: fix one vague answer with a WH follow-up
Give a time-first clause about class

rubric.mastery: Tight clauses; fully consistent order; clear pauses

assessment.fastGradeMode: Score NMM, Clause, Turn-Taking on a 3-point scale. If 2+ dimensions = Beginning, tag Reteach.
assessment.reteachFlagRule: If same NMM error repeats in ≥2 turns, assign a 90-second WH↔Y/N drill next session.

quizAnswerKey.4_short_exemplar: TODAY CLASS WHAT-TIME? → 8-O’CLOCK. TONIGHT YOU STUDY? (Y/N).
quizAnswerKey.5_reflection_expected: Name the hardest aspect (NMM switching, eye gaze, order) and a specific drill plan.

commonErrors: Using Y/N face on WH questions or vice-versa
Overlong clauses (>6 signs) that blur meaning
Looking at hands instead of partner’s face
classroomManagement: Pairs face each other; timer visible (20–30s turns)
Equity pass: each student records at least one clip
Noise control: record along the side wall; others rehearse silently

voiceflowPrompts: “Billy, run a 90-second WH vs Y/N face drill, stop if accuracy < 90%.”
“Billy, give 3 random prompt cards and check clause length ≤5 signs.”

dataReporting.grantNotes: Evidence for Perkins V communication competency, ESSA Title IV well-rounded education, and IDEA UDL accommodations. Include rubric distributions + sample artifacts in quarterly reports.

teacherReflection: Which NMM had more misses (Y/N or WH)? Which cue fixed it fastest?
Which prompt card yielded the most clarity? Keep it for reteach.
Who needs a 90-second micro-reteach next lesson?
homeExtension: Record a new 15–20s skit with a family member or friend; keep turns ≤4 signs
Write (short caption) which WH follow-up improved clarity most

compliance.ethicsLine: Obtain media consent per policy; keep videos private to class/LMS.
compliance.a11yNote: Provide multiple exemplars and time adjustments; emphasize FACE-first viewing for comprehension.
